intro: Myoxanthus vittatus, commonly known as the spotted myoxanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
